subtasks: Evaluating current economic situation (forecasts of poor year, purchasing hay, dealing with decreased hay production)
Considering future market trends (hoping for higher cattle prices, observing demand in sale barn)
Dealing with increased number of cows at sale barn (interpreting market signals)
Managing cattle feeding operations (weaning calves, backgrounding)
Determining hay purchasing and supplementing needs (quality assessment, considering to have hay tested)
Implementing feeding strategies (using liquid feed, salt mix)
Adapting to challenging market conditions (not selling off herds unless necessary)
Managing resource allocation (feeding hay, purchasing supplements)
Monitoring weather patterns and their impact (looking for rain, noting lack of moisture)
Adjusting farming practices (using supplements, considering rainy weather's effect on forage)
Managing cattle herds (weaning, keeping cows vs. selling)
Maintaining market perspective (advising buyers, considering supply and demand)
